alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Showers and thunderstorms have moved north through Fremont County and become anchored along the Owl Creek Mountains. Heavy rain is likely to cause minor flooding of creeks, streams, and arroyos within the Muddy Creek drainage. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, extreme north central Fremont. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes and draws. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This is likely causing small stream flooding and flooding of normally dry washes and draws. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shotgun Butte Road, Mail Camp Road, and rural areas of extreme north central Fremont County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
